metadata.title: CVE-2019-3842 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In systemd before v242-rc4, it was discovered that pam_systemd does notproperly sanitize the environment before using the XDG_SEAT variable. It ispossible for an attacker, in some particular configurations, to set aXDG_SEAT environment variable which allows for commands to be checkedagainst polkit policies using the "allow_active" element rather than"allow_any".

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 237-3ubuntu10.19
libnss-mymachines - 237-3ubuntu10.19
libnss-resolve - 237-3ubuntu10.19
libnss-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.19
libpam-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.19
libsystemd0 - 237-3ubuntu10.19
libudev1 - 237-3ubuntu10.19
systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.19
systemd-container - 237-3ubuntu10.19
systemd-coredump - 237-3ubuntu10.19
systemd-journal-remote - 237-3ubuntu10.19
systemd-sysv - 237-3ubuntu10.19
systemd-tests - 237-3ubuntu10.19
udev - 237-3ubuntu10.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '237-3ubuntu10.19').
